senses.de: A complete list of items such as products or goods in a particular place
senses.ex: The store performs an annual inventory of all its products.

Tips.title: Setting Context
Tips.description: Used to describe a comprehensive list in specific locations like a store or warehouse.
Tips.example: After the flood, the store needed a new inventory of its surviving stock.

Tips.title: Counting Items
Tips.description: Implies counting and describing each item, often for stock-taking or organizational purposes.
Tips.example: Please complete the inventory of office supplies by Monday.

Tips.title: Frequency Indicators
Tips.description: May be qualified by time to indicate when it's done, such as 'annual' for yearly.
Tips.example: The annual inventory helps us track product trends over time.

senses.de: The amount of goods or the value of these goods a company has to sell at a particular time
senses.ex: The car dealership had a large inventory of used cars.

Tips.title: Business Assets
Tips.description: Relates to goods a company sells, indicating its range of products or financial value.
Tips.example: The company reported an inventory worth $500,000 in their quarterly update.

Tips.title: Inventory Turnover
Tips.description: In business, it suggests how quickly products are sold and replaced over time.
Tips.example: A high inventory turnover rate might indicate strong sales.

Tips.title: Management Tools
Tips.description: Highlights the role of tracking systems and practices for managing inventory in business.
Tips.example: Our warehouse uses the latest software for inventory management.

senses.de: To make a complete list of items
senses.ex: We need to inventory all the equipment before the move.

Tips.title: Action Process
Tips.description: When used as a verb, it means to actively create a list of items.
Tips.example: We need to inventory the office computers before assigning them to the new interns.

Tips.title: Verbal Usage
Tips.description: Less common as a verb but still correct; focuses on the act of listing items systematically.
Tips.example: Could you help inventory the kitchen stock for our restaurant?

Tips.title: Preparation Context
Tips.description: Often done before events like moves, audits, or for updating systems.
Tips.example: Before the end-of-year audit, we must inventory all company assets.

Assortment.wordDefinition:
Assortment refers to a collection or variety of different things, while inventory refers to the total amount or list of goods or materials that a business or organization has in stock.

Assortment is applicable when referring to a range of products or items that are grouped together or sold as a package, such as a variety pack of snacks.

Cache.wordDefinition:
Cache generally refers to a hidden or secret store of something, often used in the context of computer data or files. For example, your web browser may have a cache that stores frequently accessed web pages to make loading faster.

So, while both cache and inventory involve keeping track of things, cache is more about storing and retrieving data or files, while inventory is more about keeping track of physical products or goods.

Catalogue.wordDefinition:
A catalogue is a list of items that a business offers for sale, while an inventory is a record of all the items a business has in stock at a given time.

Catalogues are used mainly for advertising and marketing purposes to showcase a business's products to potential customers, while inventories are used for internal management and tracking purposes to ensure that a business has enough stock to meet customer demand.

For example, a clothing store might create a catalogue of all the clothes they sell, and distribute it to customers so they can browse and choose what to buy.

A catalogue is a list of items that a business is offering for sale and is mainly used for advertising and marketing, while an inventory is a record of all the items a business has in stock at any given time and is mainly used for internal management and tracking.

Collection.wordDefinition:
A collection is a group of objects or items that are carefully chosen and gathered together by someone because they have a special value or significance.

So, while a collection is a curated selection of items that have special meaning or value to someone, an inventory is a complete record of all the goods that a business or organization has available.

List.wordDefinition:
A list refers to a simple record of items in a specific order, such as a to-do list, grocery list, or packing list. It does not necessarily include specific details about the items on the list.

Inventory is used to keep track of goods in stock, while a list is a simple record of items in a specific order.

Register.wordDefinition:
A register can refer to a variety of things, such as a list of names or a recording device used to track sales or transactions.

In a business context, a register can also refer to a cash register, which is used to process sales and record payment transactions.

Inventory refers to the goods or materials that a business has, while a register is a tool used to track sales or transactions.

Repertoire.wordDefinition:
Repertoire refers to a collection of skills, abilities or talents that a person possesses.

To summarize, inventory refers to a list of physical goods, while repertoire refers to a collection of skills, abilities or talents.

Inventory is used in the context of tracking resources, while repertoire is used in the context of someone's abilities.

Stock.wordDefinition:
Stock generally refers to the products that a retailer has available for immediate sale to customers. It specifically pertains to finished goods that are ready to be sold.

For example, a retail store may have different items in stock. The term stock is typically used in the context of a retail store.

Stock refers specifically to finished products that are available for sale in a retail store.

quotes.Text: Many people have said we just need to add more products. Look at Oracle, look at SAP. Add ERP and inventory or compensation. Add all this stuff. What we realized is we're the customer company. We're the front office solution, and our customers would be really upset if we just added a whole bunch of stuff and lost focus.
quotes.Name: Parker Harris

quotes.Text: All my life, I have taken inventory at intervals. For example, when I became a movie actor and suddenly I had to deal with fame, money and playing so many roles, I lost myself. I said, 'Who am I?' And I wrote my first book to deal with that, 'The Ragman's Son.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kirk Douglas

quotes.Text: Instead of blaming everyone and everything else for your problems, pray for God to help you take an inventory of what's been on your mind so you can think about what you've been thinking about.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: In my extensive experience, I can honestly say that Sculpture Hospitality's inventory solutions are world class and, by far, the most comprehensive in the industry.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jon Taffer

quotes.Text: I don't do much more than organise other people's ideas and insights and thoughts, and sort of harvest them, and inventory them and present them.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.Text: The inventory process and stepping back in your life can sometimes be a very dark process. But it also can be extremely funny and surprising.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Craig Charles

quotes.Text: We have so much room for improvement. Every aspect of our lives must be subjected to an inventory... of how we are taking responsibility.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Nancy Pelosi

quotes.Text: When the chips are down, life forces you to take inventory and reevaluate the people in your life.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Yolanda Hadid

quotes.Text: We want to turn our inventory faster than our people.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: James Sinegal

quotes.Text: The inventory goes down the elevator every night.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Fairfax Cone
